intro: Dasymaschalon hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white flowers that are often followed by small, round berries. This species is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
